column4: so when I D/L something from the net ... like a .tar should I unzip it and then run that command on it?
well how do I know the names of the packages I want to install? So it looks like I have the source code versions of the programmings I downloaded
what are you trying to do?
for eclipse mods, doesn't eclipse have its own package manager
this is why we have the software center
it is a gui to using apt get which is easier to search.
what you downloaded. Did it have a README or INSTALL file?
can you give me a link to what you are installing?
btw, I meant the INSTALL/README file should be found in the compressed archive (tar file)
did you take a look at their site? http://docs.aptana.com/docs/index.php/Installing_Aptana_on_Linux
if you have problems following that guide, feel free to ask questions
damn, you are right, this is not very beginner friendly
the reason you feel that way is because the instructions were made for developers and not people :-\
installing as an eclipse plugin is probably the best way.
the way they explained was much more hackish than the eclipse plugin.
depends on what stuff you are referring to. None of this had to do with the package manager
before you were asking a general question and getting a general response. the package manager was NOT the right way to handle this.
